Flatten coe list columns

press.Rd

Take all coe list columns, prefix them with list column names and return a tidy tibble. This function is typically used for analyses, after morphometrics.

press(x, keep_others)

Arguments

x

mom_tbl
keep_others

logical whether to return other columns (TRUE and default`) or only coe

Value

tibble::tibble

See also

unfold for a related reshaping

Other mom verbs: pick(), slive(), unfold()

Examples

iris %>% mom %>% press
#> ℹ press: found no coe; forward
#> # A tibble: 150 x 5
#>    Sepal.Length Sepal.Width Petal.Length Petal.Width Species
#>           <dbl>       <dbl>        <dbl>       <dbl> <fct>  
#>  1          5.1         3.5          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  2          4.9         3            1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  3          4.7         3.2          1.3         0.2 setosa 
#>  4          4.6         3.1          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  5          5           3.6          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#>  6          5.4         3.9          1.7         0.4 setosa 
#>  7          4.6         3.4          1.4         0.3 setosa 
#>  8          5           3.4          1.5         0.2 setosa 
#>  9          4.4         2.9          1.4         0.2 setosa 
#> 10          4.9         3.1          1.5         0.1 setosa 
#> # … with 140 more rows
#> ❯mom_tbl

x <- bot %>% efourier(4)
x$coe2 <- bot$coo %>% efourier(6)
x %>% press
#> # A tibble: 40 x 42
#>    type  fake  coe_a1 coe_a2 coe_a3 coe_a4 coe_b1 coe_b2 coe_b3 coe_b4 coe_c1
#>  * <fct> <fct>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>  <dbl>

#> #   coe_c4 <dbl>, coe_d1 <dbl>, coe_d2 <dbl>, coe_d3 <dbl>, coe_d4 <dbl>,

x %>% press(keep_others=FALSE) # eg for PCA
